ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Honestly, didn't gain much from this course other than a refresh on some high school concepts and a better understanding of how to estimate but not a very solid understanding. everything felt very situational.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: Small class so we were able to engage with prof and students. Prof. was able to tailer the speed and content of course to adjust for learning curves between students.  Weaknesses: extremely unorganized.

No strengths.

Weaknesses: 

Professor: Absolutely awful at pretty much everything. not to mention the grading was harsh. (he unnecessarily mentioned near the end of the term that he grades the homework hard on purpose). Not to mention his social awkwardness made it to where going to office hours would be a complete waste of time. Also lost his temper on a student that dared to ask a question. 

The Material: We delved into some rather "unconventional" methods for understanding mathematical calculations. In other words, we explored how to further complicate math.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Probably not. It was not straight forward and most of the time I was left wondering what I was supposed to be gaining.

Absolutely not
Do not, do not take this class. 

This class is not a gut or even a remotely enjoyable class. 

I learned absolutely nothing from this course, what a waste of a credit. Honestly they should really get rid of this class a whole since it really serves no purpose. (If you are simply trying to fulfill your QR do this: Take Math 107, and the Structure of Networks.
I thought this class couldn't possibly be that bad since there were only five students in the class. (More individualized attention right? Nope.)
Of course the low enrollment should have been a giant red flag.
